title: Gauss law - 10 cm radius sphere with 40 nC charge

content.question: A solid insulating sphere of radius <math alttext="10 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> has a net charge of <math alttext="40 nanocoulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nC</mi></math> distributed uniformly throughout its volume. What is the electric field at a distance of <math alttext="2.0 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cm</mi></math> from the center of the sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="7.2 times 10 cubed newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the 4 power newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>4</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the 5 power newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="9.0 times 10 to the 5 power newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="7.2 times 10 cubed newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/C</mtext></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
